name: com.kubeshark/mcp
description: Real-time Kubernetes network traffic visibility and API analysis. Query L7 API transactions (HTTP, gRPC, Redis, Kafka, DNS), L4 network flows, and manage Kubeshark deployments directly from AI assistants.

tools.name: check_kubeshark_status
tools.description: Check if Kubeshark is currently running in the cluster. Read-only operation.

tools.name: start_kubeshark
tools.description: Deploy Kubeshark to the Kubernetes cluster. Requires --allow-destructive flag.

tools.name: stop_kubeshark
tools.description: Remove Kubeshark from the Kubernetes cluster. Requires --allow-destructive flag.

tools.name: list_workloads
tools.description: List pods, services, namespaces, and nodes with observed L7 traffic.

tools.name: list_api_calls
tools.description: Query L7 API transactions (HTTP, gRPC, Redis, Kafka, DNS) with KFL filtering.

tools.name: get_api_call
tools.description: Get detailed information about a specific API call including headers and body.

tools.name: get_api_stats
tools.description: Get aggregated API statistics and metrics.

tools.name: list_l4_flows
tools.description: List L4 (TCP/UDP) network flows with traffic statistics.

tools.name: get_l4_flow_summary
tools.description: Get L4 connectivity summary including top talkers and cross-namespace traffic.

tools.name: create_snapshot
tools.description: Create a new PCAP snapshot of captured traffic.

prompts.name: analyze_traffic
prompts.description: Analyze API traffic patterns and identify issues

prompts.name: find_errors
prompts.description: Find and summarize API errors and failures

prompts.name: trace_request
prompts.description: Trace a request path through microservices

prompts.name: latency_analysis
prompts.description: Analyze latency patterns and identify slow endpoints

prompts.name: compare_traffic
prompts.description: Compare traffic patterns between time periods

url.description: Direct URL to Kubeshark Hub (e.g., https://kubeshark.example.com). When set, connects directly without kubectl/proxy.

kubeconfig.description: Path to kubeconfig file for proxy mode.

allow-destructive.description: Enable destructive operations (start_kubeshark, stop_kubeshark). Default: false for safety.

url.description: Connect directly to an existing Kubeshark deployment via URL. Cluster management tools are disabled.

proxy.description: Connect via kubectl port-forward. Requires kubeconfig access to the cluster.

proxy-destructive.description: Proxy mode with destructive operations enabled.
